topics.body:
Hey guys, I need some serious help.

Currently, this is my last year in high school before I get to choose whether to go to college, university, matriculation etc.. Problem is, I have no idea how this works.

My friends are all applying for matriculation but my mom says that matriculation only is applicable when you finished school. And then my friends explain to me about receiving a PIN or something to apply after sending the application form and I am so confused.

Even if I don't apply for matriculation, I am actually targeting to study abroad at Japan in Petroleum Engineering. Before that, I have to go through a course where I learn Japanese history, culture, language etc. and a bit of physics, mathematics, chemistry and social science.

Now it gets even more complicated. Apparently, due to me having only 11 years of education experience (most countries have 12), I have to take a special course to study exactly what I said above. Thing is, I have to have a membership with a group that takes care of education relations between Malaysia and Japan. It's located at Kuala Lumpur, no problem. It's the choice of courses that baffle me. There is a 12-months course and a 20-months to choose, which I have no idea the difference.

There is also the fact on when and how do I apply. Do I apply it after my finals and while waiting for the results? Do I do it before then? Do I do it after the results of the trial exams come out, which is before the finals? Is matriculation a requirement to this? How do I submit these forms? After I finish my Japan learning course, how do I apply for the colleges and universities in Japan? What is the time frame for the application to be eligible?

In short, I am fucking confused.

Also, I don't have a scholarship yet.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976
